title: Is the US making a great gamble to reshape Iraq?
summary: The Trump administration seeks to recalibrate US influence in the Middle East and wants to 'make Iraq great again'.

title: Investigators probing Ukraine link as Moscow car bomb kills Russian general
summary: Investigators say possibility that attack is linked to Ukrainian special forces is one line of inquiry.

title: Swiss court to hear Indonesian islanders’ climate case against cement giant
summary: Four residents of Pari, a low-lying Indonesian island, filed the complaint in January 2023.

title: LIVE: Thailand, Cambodia resume border clashes before talks
summary: Fighting has resumed hours before the countries' foreign ministers meet in Malaysia to discuss steps to de-escalate.

title: Sudanese bloc declares Nairobi roadmap, but is it a civilian breakthrough?
summary: The new bloc's roadmap echoes the Quad plan, but observers say this only splinters civilian forces in Sudan.

title: US says talks with Russia, Ukraine in Miami ‘constructive, productive’
summary: US envoy holds separate meetings with Russian and Ukrainian negotiators in Miami on ending Russia's war in Ukraine.

title: Two Palestine Action hunger strikers in UK prisons admitted to hospital
summary: Kamran Ahmed and Amu Gib have been hospitalised as a hunger strike that began 50 days ago raises alarm.

title: New clashes erupt on Thai-Cambodia border as ASEAN convenes peace talks
summary: Fighting resumes hours before regional foreign ministers meet in Malaysia to discuss steps to de-escalate hostilities.

title: Malaysian court rejects Najib’s bid to serve sentence under house arrest
summary: The Kuala Lumpur High Court says a royal document allowing the ex-PM's transfer to house arrest is invalid.

title: Morocco seal AFCON win against Comoros in 2025 opener
summary: Host nation Morocco overcome a spirited challenge by Africa Cup of Nations minnows Comoros to kick off the tournament.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 1,397
summary: These are the key developments from day 1,397 of Russia’s war on Ukraine.

title: ‘Alarming’ medicine shortages in Gaza amid Israeli restrictions
summary: Gaza's Health Ministry says the most critical drug shortages are in emergency services.

title: Le discours aux Armées d'Emmanuel Macron à Abou Dhabi
summary: Suivez le discours du Président français en direct sur France24.

title: Enquête sur le 7-octobre : rassemblement anti-Netanyahu à Tel-Aviv
summary: A Tel-Aviv, des centaines de personnes se sont rassemblées pour protester contre Netanyahu, nommé à la tête de la commission chargée d'enquêter sur le massacre du 7-octobre.

title: Emmanuel Macron aux Emirats pour fêter Noël avec les troupes françaises
summary: Emmanuel Macron a entamé dimanche matin une visite aux Emirats arabes unis pour célébrer Noël avec les forces françaises qui y sont déployées et vanter son partenariat avec ce pays du Golfe, dont Paris espère plus de coopération dans sa lutte contre le narcotrafic.

title: Syrie : les États-Unis annoncent des frappes "massives" contre l'État Islamique
summary: Le Pentagone a annoncé avoir lancé une opération "massive" en Syrie contre des combattants du groupe État islamique, des infrastructures et des sites d'armement, vendredi. Il s'agit de "très lourdes représailles" après l'attaque qui a coûté samedi la vie à deux militaires américains et un traducteur en Syrie, affirme Donald Trump. Récit d'Élise Gallé-Tessonneau.

title: La France va construire un nouveau porte-avion, remplaçant du Charles de Gaulle
summary: Emmanuel Macron a entamé, dimanche, une visite aux Émirats arabes unis afin de fêter Noël avec les forces françaises qui y sont déployées et de mettre en avant le partenariat stratégique entre Paris et Abu Dhabi. Lors d'une allocution il a annoncé la construction d'un futur porte-avions qui doit entrer en service en 2038.

title: Gaza: la famine est terminée mais l'insécurité alimentaire persiste, selon l'ONU
summary: La famine à Gaza est terminée, mais la majorité de la population de la bande reste confrontée à des niveaux élevés d'insécurité alimentaire, a indiqué vendredi l'ONU. "A la suite du cessez-le-feu déclaré le 10 octobre 2025, la dernière analyse IPC indique une amélioration notable de la sécurité alimentaire et de la nutrition", analyse le Cadre intégré de classification de la sécurité alimentaire (IPC), un organisme de l'ONU basé à Rome. Néanmoins, la majorité de la population de la bande de Gaza reste "confrontée à des niveaux élevés d'insécurité alimentaire" et la situation reste "critique" en dépit d'un "meilleur accès pour les livraisons alimentaires humanitaires et commerciales". Récit de Jean Barrère.

title: L'Iran exécute un homme accusé d'espionnage au profit d'Israël
summary: Depuis l’attaque israélienne d’ampleur contre des sites militaires et nucléaires iraniens cet été, les exécutions en Iran se sont accélérées. Un homme condamné pour espionnage au profit d'Israël a été pendu samedi. La République islamique a durci sa législation : désormais "toute activité de renseignement ou d'espionnage" est passible de peine de mort. Les précisions du correspondant de France 24 à Téhéran, Siavosh Ghazi.

title: Les États-Unis annoncent une opération "massive" en Syrie, au moins cinq membres de l'EI tués
summary: Le Pentagone a annoncé avoir lancé une opération "massive" en Syrie contre des combattants du groupe État islamique, des infrastructures et des sites d'armement, vendredi. Il s'agit de représailles après l'attaque qui a coûté la vie à deux militaires américains et un traducteur en Syrie, affirme Donald Trump. Au moins cinq membres de l'EI ont été tués, selon Washington.

title: La force de maintien de la paix déjà en Israël ? Ce que l'on sait de ces images d'une base militaire
summary: Les forces de maintien de la paix pour Gaza déjà positionnées en Israël ? Depuis le 16 décembre circule une vidéo qui montrerait cette force internationale prévue dans la deuxième phase du cessez-le-feu entre le Hamas et Israël. Mais cette base, construite dès mai, n'est pas récente, et était en réalité utilisée par la Gaza Humanitarian Foundation.

title: Drapeaux israéliens, auto-détermination : la rupture grandissante des Druzes syriens face au pouvoir
summary: Fin novembre, des Druzes syriens ont défilé à Soueïda avec des drapeaux israéliens et des affiches à l'effigie de Benyamin Netanyahou. Une scène qui symbolise la fracture entre le pouvoir central syrien et une grande partie de la communauté druze, qui se sent de plus en plus menacée.

title: Gaza : plus de 1 000 patients sont morts en attendant leur évacuation médicale depuis juillet 2024
summary: Quelque 1 092 personnes sont décédées entre juillet 2024 et fin novembre 2025 dans la bande de Gaza, alors qu'elles attendaient leur évacuation sanitaire, a annoncé l'Organisation mondiale de la santé (OMS) vendredi. Celles-ci s'effectuent encore aujourd'hui au compte-gouttes, malgré la trêve entrée en vigueur le 10 octobre.

title: Syrie : la contrebande d’essence, une activité à haut risque entre les lignes de front
summary: À moto ou en camionnette, des dizaines de Syriens bravent chaque jour les dangers pour acheminer du carburant entre les zones contrôlées par les Kurdes des Forces démocratiques syriennes (FDS) et celles du gouvernement. Un trafic qui prospère sur fond de crise économique, malgré les risques mortels encourus.

title: Christel Coton, sociologue : « L’armée n’est plus perçue par la jeunesse comme une institution guerrière mais de protection »
summary: Dans un entretien au « Monde », la spécialiste de la sociologie militaire décrypte les ressorts par lesquels l’institution participe à nouveau aux politiques d’insertion professionnelle des jeunes, avec, par exemple, la mise en place du service militaire volontaire, à partir de 2026.

title: Les assaillants de l’attentat de Sydney se sont entraînés en Australie, selon la police
summary: Les forces de l’ordre ont aussi rapporté qu’une vidéo avait été découverte, dans laquelle le père et son fils fustigent les « sionistes », assis devant un drapeau de l’organisation Etat islamique.

title: En Ukraine, les nouvelles règles de sortie du territoire accélèrent l’exode d’une génération de jeunes adultes
summary: Adoptée fin août, une loi autorisant les hommes de 18 à 22 ans à quitter temporairement le territoire permet aux jeunes de garder un lien avec leur famille, mais la mesure inquiète les responsables militaires et les chefs d’entreprise.

title: A Thanksgiving, la dinde est-elle démocrate ?
summary: « Mon Noël sous Trump » (1/5). La journaliste Georgia Husson a emménagé à New York, en pleins préparatifs des fêtes de fin d’année. Aujourd’hui, elle nous raconte le Friendsgiving d’une bande d’amis dans le Connecticut. Un festin où les opinions politiques s’affrontent.

title: A Phoenix, J. D. Vance s’impose en successeur de Donald Trump et défend son nationalisme religieux : « Le christianisme est la foi de l’Amérique »
summary: Le vice-président américain a clôturé la conférence de Turning Point USA, dimanche 21 décembre. Il s’est inscrit dans le sillage de Donald Trump, tout en donnant à son discours un contenu idéologique fondé sur le nationalisme chrétien. Il a assuré au public : « Vous n’avez plus à vous excuser d’être blanc. »

title: Semi-conducteurs : Nvidia, emblème de la nouvelle bataille du Pacifique
summary: « Les puces, pétrole du XXIᵉ siècle » (1/5). Intelligence artificielle, électronique, défense… La « silicium economy » irrigue toute l’industrie et les services. Elle est au centre d’une lutte sans merci entre les puissances, la Chine cherchant à se défaire de sa dépendance aux technologies américaines.

title: « Les partisans d’une abrogation de l’interdiction des voitures thermiques ont obtenu une victoire à la Pyrrhus »
summary: Contrairement aux apparences, la proposition de la Commission européenne d’assouplir la transition vers le véhicule électrique est un recul très relatif, qui ne remet pas en cause les ambitions climatiques, estime Stéphane Lauer, éditorialiste au « Monde ».

title: Le futur porte-avions français, une annonce à point nommé « à l’heure des prédateurs »
summary: Emmanuel Macron a confirmé la construction du remplaçant du « Charles-de-Gaulle », pour une mise en service en 2038. Avec un équipage de 2 000 marins, il pourra embarquer 30 avions de combat, plusieurs types de drones aériens et de nombreux systèmes de guerre électronique.

title: Guerre en Ukraine : les négociations rentrent dans le dur, Vladimir Poutine se dit « prêt au dialogue » avec Emmanuel Macron
summary: Après trois jours d’échanges entre les émissaires de Donald Trump et les représentants ukrainiens et russes à Miami, menés en présence d’émissaires français, allemands et britanniques, les discussions achoppent toujours sur les questions territoriales.

title: En Turquie, derrière la disgrâce d’un présentateur vedette, les luttes intestines du pouvoir
summary: L’influent animateur de télévision Mehmet Akif Ersoy a été arrêté dans le cadre d’une enquête pour trafic de drogue et placé en détention provisoire. Une affaire révélatrice des luttes intestines au sein de l’élite islamiste du régime.

title: EN DIRECT, guerre en Ukraine : un général de l’état-major russe tué dans une explosion à Moscou, selon le comité d’enquête russe
summary: Une enquête pour « meurtre » du général Fanil Sarvarov, chef du département de la formation opérationnelle au sein de l’état-major, a été ouverte, a précisé le comité. L’une des pistes étudiées est celle « liée » aux « services spéciaux ukrainiens », selon la même source.

title: A Gaza, le patriarche latin de Jérusalem célèbre les chrétiens, « solides » dans une « mer de destruction »
summary: Le cardinal Pierbattista Pizzaballa, chef de l’Eglise catholique en terre sainte, s’est rendu une nouvelle fois dans la bande de Gaza pour y célébrer la messe de Noël. La plus grande de partie de la communauté chrétienne, réduite à 600 personnes, vit toujours réfugiée au sein de la paroisse.

title: Israeli forces seal Ramallah town, set up checkpoints
summary:
Israeli forces seal Ramallah town, set up checkpoints

Israeli forces on Monday sealed the town of Atara by closing the iron gate and erected a checkpoint at the entrances to Nabi Saleh and Aboud, north of Ramallah, Palestinian news agency Wafa reported. 

The report said that Israeli soldiers stopped and searched several vehicles and checked the IDs of their passengers, causing severe traffic congestion in the area.

title: Israeli forces demolish apartment building near Al-Aqsa Mosque, displacing residents
summary:
Israeli forces demolish apartment building near Al-Aqsa Mosque, displacing residents

Israeli forces on Monday demolished a residential building in the Wadi Qaddum neighbourhood, south of the Al-Aqsa Mosque, Palestinian news agency Wafa reported. 

The building contained 13 apartments and housed approximately 100 people, the report said. 

Israelis forces closed off the Wadi Qaddum area and a large force of the army, accompanied by bulldozers, stormed the neighbourhood and destroyed the residential building.

title: Video: Palestinians hold funeral for 22-year-old killed in Israeli raid
summary:
Video: Palestinians hold funeral for 22-year-old killed in Israeli raid

Palestinians carried the body of Ahmad Ziyoud, 22, through the streets of Silat al-Harithiya, near Jenin in the northern occupied West Bank, during a funeral procession following his death in an Israeli raid in which he was shot in the chest.

Palestinians carried the body of Ahmad Ziyoud, 22, through the streets of Silat al-Harithiya, near Jenin in the northern occupied West Bank, during a funeral procession following his death in an Israeli raid in which he was shot in the chest pic.twitter.com/a4XjqNF1vq

— Middle East Eye (@MiddleEastEye) December 21, 2025

title: Israel to allow 10,000 reservists to keep military rifles at home, says report
summary:
Israel to allow 10,000 reservists to keep military rifles at home, says report

The Israeli military has revealed plans to arm about 10,000 reserve soldiers with weapons that will be "kept permanently" in their homes, Anadolu news agency reported, quoting Israeli media. 

Yedioth Ahronoth reported that the move focusses on Division David, a formation established about a year ago that relies on older reservists who volunteer to return to service after completing their reserve obligations.

The reservists will receive an M4 or upgraded M16 rifle, magazines, a combat vest and a helmet, the paper said.  

The rifles would remain in their personal possession most of the time while they are civilians, according to the report.

title: Israel releases six Palestinian prisoners as ICRC denied jail access
summary:
Israel releases six Palestinian prisoners as ICRC denied jail access

Six Palestinian prisoners were released from Israeli detention on Sunday and were transferred to the hospital through the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC), Anadolu news agency reported. 

The released prisoners were taken to theAl-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in the central Gaza city of Deir al-Balah.

ICRC said that it has not been granted access to Palestinians held in Israeli detention facilities since October 2023.

title: UK condemns Israel’s approval of 19 new West Bank settlements
summary:
UK condemns Israel’s approval of 19 new West Bank settlements

The United Kingdom on Sunday condemned the Israeli government's approval of 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank, saying that they are illegal under international law. 

"The UK condemns the Israeli government’s approval of 19 new settlements in Palestine. These are illegal under international law," Hamish Falconer, the British minister for the Middle East, wrote on the US social media company X. 

"This risks undermining the 20 Point Plan and prospects for the long-term peace and security that only a two-state solution can deliver," Falconer said. 

Falconer's remarks came after Israel approved a proposal for 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank.

title: Israeli attorney general says Netanyahu government will influence 7 October investigation
summary:
Israeli attorney general says Netanyahu government will influence 7 October investigation

Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara on Sunday said that the commission of inquiry which is being pushed by the government will not allow the investigation of the truth of the 7 October attack. 

According to the attorney general, the proposed plan is "riddled with fundamental flaws" and "prioritises political considerations over the principles of an independent, impartial, and professional investigation."

Israeli media reported that the bill to establish a politicised commission of inquiry will see Prime Minister Netanyahu have direct influence on its composition and mandate.

title: Morning update
summary:
Morning update

Good morning, Middle East Eye readers. Here are the latest updates:

  • The UK has condemned the Israeli government's approval of 19 new illegal settlements in the occupied West Bank, saying that the move risks undermining the 20 Point Plan and prospects for long-term peace. 

  • Six Palestinian detainees who were released from Israeli detention and were transferred to Al-Aqsa Martyrs Hospital in the central Gaza city of Deir al-Balah through the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC). 

  • Israeli military is gearing up to arm 10,000 reserve soldiers with weapons that will be kept permanently in their homes, Israeli media have reported. 

  • Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has apologised over the Bondi Beach attack that targeted a Hanukkah event, saying that he's sorry for what the Jewish community has experienced.

  • Israel's Attorney General Gali Baharav-Miara said that the Netanyahu government's probe will not allow for investigating the truth about the 7 October attack.

title: Evening recap
summary:
Evening recap

Our live blog will shortly be closing until tomorrow morning.

Here are the day's key developments:

  • The Israeli military killed three Palestinians in the Shujaiya neighbourhood east of Gaza City on Sunday morning, according to local medical sources.

  • Israel's security cabinet has approved a new proposal by Finance Minister Bezalel Smotrich and Defence Minister Israel Katz to recognise 19 new settlements in the occupied West Bank. 

  • Israel's far-right National Security Minister Itamar Ben Gvir has proposed creating a “detention facility surrounded by crocodiles” to hold Palestinian prisoners, Israeli media reported on Sunday.

  • Israeli strikes in south Lebanon on Sunday killed one person and wounded another, the Lebanese health ministry said, as Israel's military claimed it targeted Hezbollah members.

  • WHO chief said 100,000 children in Gaza are projected to suffer acute malnutrition through April.

  • The Israeli Supreme Court has decided to set 4 January as the final deadline for Israel to respond to a petition by the Foreign Press Association for media access to Gaza.

  • Israeli forces arrested five Palestinians, injured multiple others across the occupied West Bank, the Wafa news agency reported.

title: Trump admin denies it will spend $60B to rebuild Gaza as high-tech, luxury destination
summary:
Trump admin denies it will spend $60B to rebuild Gaza as high-tech, luxury destination

The Trump administration on Sunday denied a Wall Street Journal report that it will be paying $60 billion to turn Gaza Strip into a destination with luxury resorts, high-speed rail, and AI-optimised energy networks.

The report said on Friday that the United States has presented a proposal to potential donor countries that would reconstruct Gaza as a high-tech coastal area over the next two decades, at a projected cost of $112 billion, with the US contributing $60 billion.

“This is fake news. Nowhere in the plan does it say the US will pay $60 billion," The State Department’s Near Eastern Affairs Bureau said in a post on X, while avoiding commenting on the other revelations in the report.

This is fake news.

Nowhere in the plan does it say the U.S. will pay $60 billion. https://t.co/yoglZ36vAI

— U.S. State Dept - Near Eastern Affairs (@StateDept_NEA) December 21, 2025

title: Israeli forces shoot, injure 19-year-old in Qalqilya
summary:
Israeli forces shoot, injure 19-year-old in Qalqilya

Israeli forces fired tear gas and live ammunition during a raid on the city of Qalqilya in the occupied West Bank, wounding a 19-year-old Palestinian in the leg, the Wafa news agency reported.

The teenager was taken to hospital, the report said.

title: The Israeli foreign minister calls on Jews to settle in Israel
summary:
The Israeli foreign minister calls on Jews to settle in Israel

Israeli foreign minister Gideon Saar called on Jews from Western countries to move to Israel following last week’s deadly shooting at a Hanukkah celebration in Australia.

"Today, I call upon the Jews of England, the Jews of France, the Jews of Australia, the Jews of Canada, the Jews of Belgium: come to the Land of Israel! Come home!" he said.

According to Israel's 1950 "Law of Return," every Jew in the world can make aliyah and obtain Israeli citizenship. The law also applies to people with at least one Jewish grandparent. 

Those who complete the Aliyah process are required to sign up for military service.

The minister’s call comes as Israel’s military chief said the army does not have enough combat soldiers and is seeking to recruit ultra-Orthodox Jews.

title: Bondi gunmen threw bombs that didn’t go off, condemned ‘Zionists’ before attack — police
summary:
A statement from police, released after defendant Naveed Akram appeared in court, details how he and his father trained for the terror attack, and their 'justification' for it

Despite constant stream of online hate, visiting creators say they receive more love than vitriol as they fight disinformation and bolster Jewish pride post-Oct. 7

Neither is named in Foreign Ministry statement; country, a popular destination for Israelis, consistently ranks as one of the world's most dangerous for road traffic

title: US pursuing third oil tanker near Venezuela, officials say
summary:
Move follows Trump’s declaration of blockade on sanctioned Venezuelan oil; seizures may affect oil prices, analysts say

title: Leading GOP senator: Hamas must be given deadline to disarm or face renewed war
summary:
Lindsey Graham tells Times of Israel the US should join future attack on Hezbollah; Iran should be attacked now if it is rebuilding nuclear and missile programs

title: Tehran: Israel has long history of false flag operations
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Foreign Ministry spokesperson Esmaeil Baqaei says the Israeli regime has a long-standing record of designing and carrying out false flag operations, stressing that many cases are now recognized as proven examples.

title: Iran, Turkmenistan discuss Caspian Sea cooperation
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Deputy Foreign Minister for Legal and International Affairs Kazem Gharibabadi has met with Turkmenistan’s Special Representative for Caspian Sea Affairs Murad Atajanov to review the latest developments concerning the Caspian Sea and the upcoming 7th Summit of Caspian littoral states scheduled to be held in Tehran in the summer of 2026.

title: Iranians mark Yalda night nationwide as ancient festival of light, family, and hope
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iranians across the country celebrated Yalda night, the longest night of the year, gathering in homes and public spaces to observe one of the most enduring traditions in Iranian culture, an occasion centered on family togetherness, hope and the symbolic triumph of light over darkness.

title: IRNA selected photos of the month
summary: The following is a collection of selected photographs capturing events and incidents across Iran, taken by IRNA photojournalists during the Persian calendar month of Azar (November 22–December 21, 2025).

title: OIC calls for accountability, justice for Israeli crimes in Gaza
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Organization of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) has condemned the ongoing Israeli crimes against Palestinians, including the recent deadly attack on a wedding ceremony at a school sheltering displaced civilians in Gaza City.

title: Yalda Night celebrated in Russia, Pakistan
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Traditional celebrations marking Yalda Night, the winter solstice, and the longest night of the year in the Iranian calendar, were held in Moscow and several cities across Pakistan, underscoring shared cultural values centered on light, unity, and human connection.

title: Pezeshkian: Cooperation between Iran and Eurasia lays foundation for a strong region
summary: Moscow, IRNA – In a message to the meeting of the Supreme Council of the Eurasian Economic Union, Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has stressed that cooperation between Iran and the member states of this union is a long-term strategy for creating a powerful region by strengthening national sovereignty.

title: Iranian, Pakistani foreign ministers discuss bilateral ties, regional developments on phone
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Mohammad Ishaq Dar, Foreign Minister of the Islamic Republic of Pakistan, held a telephone conversation with Seyyed Abbas Araqchi on Sunday to discuss bilateral relations and regional developments.

title: Iranian naval flotillas set sail for South Africa, Navy commander says
summary: Tehran, IRNA – The Commander of the Iranian Army’s Naval Force, Rear Admiral Shahram Irani, says the 103rd and 104th flotillas of the Iranian Naval Force have set sail for South Africa.

title: Events of past two years exposed criminal natural of US, Israel: Iran’s top general
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Chairman of the Chief of Staff of Iran’s Armed Forces Major General Abdolrahim Mousavi says the events over the past two years have proven to the world the criminal nature of the United States and the Israeli regime.

title: Iran and China have great potential to bolster multilateralism: Envoy
summary: Tehran, IRNA – Iran’s Ambassador to China, Abdolreza Rahmani-Fazli, says Iran and China, as two independent actors of the Global South, possess significant capacities to strengthen multilateralism.

title: La Liga: Villarreal vs. Barcelona preview, team news, lineups
summary: League leaders Barcelona head to the Estadio de la Cerámica on Sunday afternoon to face an in-form Villarreal side sitting third in La Liga.

title: Public unity thwarted enemy’s plans in 12-day war
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – The 12-day war with Israel ended in failure for Tel Aviv, as Iran’s popular unity and swift public response thwarted attempts to spark internal unrest, IRGC Spokesman Brigadier General Ali Mohammad Naeini says.

title: VIDEO: Budget debate turns violent in Turkish parliament
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – A physical altercation erupted among lawmakers in Turkey’s parliament on Monday during a session on the 2026 budget, forcing the speaker to suspend proceedings.

title: Iran rejects missile talks, says contacts with IAEA underway
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Iranian Foreign Ministry spokesperson says that the country’s missile program has been developed exclusively to defend Iran’s territorial integrity and is not subject to negotiation.

title: Conflict with Thailand leaves 525,000 Cambodians displaced
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – More than half a million Cambodian residents have left their homes due to the escalating conflict on the border with Thailand, the Interior Ministry says.

title: US tanker with Venezuelan oil left for US: Official
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Venezuela has sent a tanker belonging to the US company Chevron with Venezuelan oil to the US amid the seizure of ships under US sanctions in the Caribbean Sea, VP and Hydrocarbons Minister Delcy Rodriguez reported.

title: Tel Aviv warns US CENTCOM over Iran’s missile movements
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – A US media outlet reports that Israel’s army chief has warned the US Central Command (CENTCOM) that Iran’s recent missile activity could be used as cover for a surprise attack.

title: Israeli media reveals hidden damage from Iran missile strikes
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – An Israeli media outlet has acknowledged that Iranian missiles inflicted significant damage during the 12-day war, impacts that Tel Aviv has so far kept out of the public narrative.

title: Iran-EAEU partnership can shape powerful region
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Iran’s president has outlined long-term strategic cooperation with the Eurasian Economic Union as a foundation for regional strength and economic sovereignty.

title: Iranians celebrate Yalda Night at Hafez Tomb in Shiraz
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Iranians gathered at the mausoleum of the renowned Persian poet Hafez in Shiraz to celebrate Yalda Night, one of Iran’s oldest and most cherished cultural traditions.

title: Iraqi security forces conduct intelligence operation in Syria
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Iraq’s security forces have carried out a rare special operation inside Syrian territory, arresting two key suspects linked to the transfer of weapons and terrorist elements toward Iraq, a senior Iraqi security official said.

title: Imam Muhammad al-Baqir, the splitter and spreader of sciences
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Today coincides with the birth anniversary of the 5th Imam of Shia, Muhammad al-Baqir. An overview of his life is provided in the following article.

title: Front pages of Iran’s English dailies on December 22
summary: TEHRAN, Dec. 22 (MNA) – Here are the front pages of Iran's English language dailies on Monday, December 22.

title: وضعیت جوی و دریایی استان بوشهر آرام است
summary: بوشهر- کارشناس اداره‌کل هواشناسی استان بوشهر گفت: بر اساس نقشه‌های هواشناسی وضعیت جوی و دریایی استان تا روز چهارشنبه در اغلب ساعات آرام است .

title: مدارس ۸ شهرستان خراسان رضوی در نوبت عصر امروز غیرحضوری شد
summary: بارش برف، برودت هوا و یخبندان معابر، مدارس ۸ شهرستان خراسان رضوی را در نوبت عصر غیرحضوری کرد.

title: اعمال نظارت دیوان محاسبات در صیانت از امنیت دارویی و سلامت عمومی
summary: دیوان محاسبات کشور جهت پیشگیری از مخاطرات احتمالی، کلیه فرآیندهای مرتبط با ایجاد و مدیریت ذخایر راهبردی اقلام سلامت‌محور را بررسی و پیشنهادهای اصلاحی را ارائه کرد.

title: دبیرکل ناتو، چین و روسیه را تهدیدی برای اروپا اعلام کرد
summary: دبیر کل سازمان پیمان آتلانتیک شمالی (ناتو)، چین و روسیه را تهدیدی برای اروپا اعلام کرد.

title: برف و باران در البرز از چهارشنبه؛ سرمای زیر صفر در راه است
summary: کرج- مدیرکل هواشناسی استان البرز از احتمال بارش‌های پراکنده برف و باران در برخی نقاط استان از روز چهارشنبه هفته جاری خبر داد و نسبت به کاهش محسوس دما در مناطق مختلف هشدار داد.

title: مدیرعامل توزیع برق تهران: مصرف خانگی برق تا ۲۰ درصد کاهش می‌یابد
summary: تهران- مدیرعامل شرکت توزیع برق استان تهران اعلام کرد: با اجرای طرح ملی «سفیران برق و انرژی» و آموزش کودکان و بانوان، مصرف برق خانگی تا ۲۰ درصد کاهش می‌یابد.
